IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION RAISES FUNDS THROUGH VARIOUS FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, SUCH AS, THE MAGICAL FOREST AND THE LAS VEGAS GREAT SANTA RUN. THESE FUNDS ARE USED TO SERVE PEOPLE OF NEVADA WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES BY ENHANCING THEIR LIVES AND THE LIVES OF THEIR FAMILIES. CAPITAL CAMPAIGNS ARE UNDERTAKEN TO PROVIDE THE FACILITIES AND ONGOING OPERATING DOLLARS FOR THESE PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION RAISES FUNDS THROUGH VARIOUS FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, SUCH AS THE MAGICAL FOREST AND THE LAS VEGAS GREAT SANTA RUN. THESE FUNDS ARE USED TO SERVE PEOPLE OF NEVADA WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES, TO ENHANCE THEIR LIVES AND THE LIVES OF THEIR FAMILIES. CAPITAL CAMPAIGNS ARE UNDERTAKEN TO PROVIDE FACILITIES AND ONGOING OPERATING DOLLARS FOR THESE PROGRAMS.
IRS990.Desc: OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION PROVIDES MILLIONS OF DOLLARS EACH YEAR IN OPERATING SUBSIDIES FOR OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE THAT ENABLE OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE TO SERVE PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING VOCATIONAL TRAINING, COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT, DAY SERVICES, ADVOCACY, AND ARTS AND SOCIAL RECREATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOLLOWING ENDOWMENTS ARE HELD: - LIED FOUNDATION ENDOWMENT - EARNINGS UNRESTRICTED - WALTERS ENDOWMENT - MAGICAL FOREST - ENGELSTAD SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENT - SCHOLARSHIPS - CRAWFORD ENDOWMENT - MAGICAL FOREST - FORREST ENDOWMENT - EARNINGS UNRESTRICTED - NITZ SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENT - SCHOLARSHIPS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE, A RELATED 501C3 TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. THE FOUNDATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDING THROUGH PERIODIC REPORTING FROM OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION SURVEYS, WRITTEN CONTRACTS, APPROVAL BY BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, AND FORM 990 OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ALL UTILIZED TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION.

OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION RAISES FUNDS THROUGH VARIOUS FUNDRAISING EFFORTS, SUCH AS THE MAGICAL FOREST AND THE LAS VEGAS GREAT SANTA RUN. THESE FUNDS ARE USED TO SERVE PEOPLE OF NEVADA WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES, TO ENHANCE THEIR LIVES AND THE LIVES OF THEIR FAMILIES. CAPITAL CAMPAIGNS ARE UNDERTAKEN TO PROVIDE FACILITIES AND ONGOING OPERATING DOLLARS FOR THESE PROGRAMS.
VOLUNTEERS ARE USED TO ASSIST IN THE EVENTS HELD BY THE FOUNDATION.
OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE ALL MEMBERS OF THE SOUTHERN NEVADA BUSINESS COMMUNITY. AS SUCH, THEY HAVE BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS WITH EACH OTHER IN THE ORDINARY COURSE OF BUSINESS.
OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION HAS A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE TO PROVIDE VARIOUS MANAGEMENT DUTIES.

A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 AND SUPPORTING SCHEDULES IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE PRIOR TO FILING. QUESTIONS, COMMENTS AND SUGGESTED CHANGES MADE BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ARE REVIEWED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE AND CONTROLLER ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHERE NECESSARY. AFTER CORRECTIONS, A FINAL DRAFT IS PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING.

ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS ARE REQUIRED BY EACH BOARD MEMBER. PERIODIC REVIEWS OF RELATED TRANSACTIONS ARE PERFORMED TO REVIEW COMPENSATION, PROPER RECORDING, AND WHETHER AGREEMENTS AND TRANSACTIONS FURTHER THE ORGANIZATION'S CHARITABLE PURPOSES. INVESTIGATIONS ARE PERFORMED IF THE BOARD/COMMITTEE HAS REASONABLE BELIEF OF FAILURE OF PROPER DISCLOSURE WITH APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION IMPLEMENTED AS NECESSARY.

THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES AN OUTSIDE PROFESSIONAL COMPANY TO PROVIDE SALARY/COMPENSATION INFORMATION. IF BONUSES ARE TO BE PROVIDED, THEY ARE ESTABLISHED BASED ON INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS. COMPENSATION AND BONUSES MUST BE APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND THE WAGE AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES AN OUTSIDE PROFESSIONAL COMPANY TO PROVIDE SALARY/COMPENSATION INFORMATION. IF BONUSES ARE TO BE PROVIDED, THEY ARE ESTABLISHED BASED ON INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS. COMPENSATION AND BONUSES MUST BE APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND THE WAGE AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND 990 ARE PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.

PART VII, SECTION A AND SCHEDULE J ROBERT (BOB) BROWN IS THE PRESIDENT & CEO OF OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION AND OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE, A RELATED ORGANIZATION. OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE PAYS BOB BROWN'S SALARY IN FULL. BOB BROWN'S COMPENSATION FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR 2022 WAS 413,751 IN SALARY, 22,505 IN BENEFITS, AND DEFERRED COMPENSATION OF 18,000 FOR A TOTAL COMPENSATION OF 454,256. CATHY HANNA IS THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER OF OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION AND OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE, A RELATED ORGANIZATION. OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE PAYS CATHY HANNA'S SALARY IN FULL. CATHY HANNA'S COMPENSATION FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR 2022 WAS 178,099 IN SALARY, 11,861 IN BENEFITS, AND 2,000 IN RETIREMENT CONTRIBUTIONS FOR A TOTAL COMPENSATION OF 191,960.
OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE FOUNDATION PERFORMS ALL FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES FOR OPPORTUNITY VILLAGE. AS THIS IS AN IN-KIND SERVICE, THERE ARE NO EXPENSES LISTED IN SCHEDULE R.
